Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module C
Section 3: Emergency Preparedness, Response & Recovery

Phases of Emergency Management

Emergency Management is a process that involves three main steps.

1

Preparedness

Preparedness takes place before the emergency. It involves evaluating possible hazards, establishing community connections, securing communication and writing a plan of action.

2

Response

Response begins the moment you are aware there is an emergency and continues until the emergency is over. It involves your actions during the disaster.

3

Recovery

Recovery begins as soon as the emergency is over. It includes meeting basic needs, rebuilding your program, and meeting the emotional needs of the children and staff.

All these phases will be discussed in more detail later in this training.
